intro: Erythrocephalum helenae, commonly known as Helen’s redhead, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Its striking red to pink flowers bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It is a low-growing shrub that is well adapted to the arid and semi-arid environments of its native habitat.
